intro: Buchnera disticha, commonly known as the two-branched buckwheat, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Buchnera disticha typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
